Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Crostwight Road.

We can confirm that once power has been restored to the area that the works to test a transformer near Tempsford Road will be completed which will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-23945-O. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 00:07 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but one property in the Millfield area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power due to an unexpected gas leak in the area but we have been told it is safe to restore power.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We have been in touch with our engineers and they have advised that at this stage we're estimating to have the power back on between 00:30 and 01:30. Its possible this time frame may need to be adjusted depending on how the work progresses.

Rest assured though, our engineers work around the clock and I will keep you updated with any further news we may receive. Sent by Will at 23:57.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry you're without power this evening. Whilst working on our underground network cabling, our engineers reported a gas leak was apparent and for safety, had to stop work. We are working with the utility and will continue our repairs as soon as it is safe for us to do so. As such we're not able to give an estimated time for power to be on at the moment.

We're really sorry for the disruption there, we'll update you as soon as work recommences. Sent by Will at 23:46.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I am the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks in Ipswich. Today's power cut was unexpected, so we were unable to provide you with prior notice to help you plan ahead. I am pleased to confirm that we managed to resolve this by diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible. Just so you know, we text customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in the future you can do so here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L. This was a widespread problem on the underground network and I personally apologise for any disruption this has caused to your day. If you have any questions or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 10:06 - Our engineers have restored power to all 1198 properties in the CM8 0 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around the fault.

Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 09:58 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are currently checking our network equipment throughout the area. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the GU4 8 area and are investigating the overhead network fault that originally affected 239 properties. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 216 customers. There are now 23 properties still affected and using an average time frame we're estimating all power will be on between 11:00 and 12:00, but this may change later depending on what our staff find. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Simon at 09:35.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sorry your power has gone off again today; our engineers previously diverted the electricity around the faulted part of the network remotely. However, this has not held and we believe there may be an underlying issue.

We have your information from the earlier power cut so will continue to send progress updates to you until all power is back on. Sent by Simon at 09:29.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 08:55 - Our engineers have restored power to all 239 properties in the GU4 8 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around an underground cable fault..

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 08:11. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Our engineers had to redirect power due to a fault on the electricity network.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Maisy at 10:10 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 239 customers in the GU4 8 area, by diverting power around a faulted piece of overhead network equipment. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Sent by Simon at 09:58 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are currently checking our network equipment throughout the area. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the GU4 8 area and are investigating the overhead network fault that originally affected 239 properties.

You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 216 customers. There are now 23 properties still affected and using an average time frame we're estimating all power will be on between 11:00 and 12:00, but this may change later depending on what our staff find.

We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Simon at 09:35.

Sorry your power has gone off again today; our engineers previously diverted the electricity around the faulted part of the network remotely. However, this has not held and we believe there may be an underlying issue.

We have your information from the earlier power cut so will continue to send progress updates to you until all power is back on. Sent by Simon at 09:29.

Sent by Simon at 08:55 - Our engineers have restored power to all 239 properties in the GU4 8 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around an underground cable fault..

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
